isis.stitle: International® DT 466E, DT 466, 530, 530E, and HT 530 Diesel Engines - Vibration Damper, Crankshaft, Main Bearings, Flywheel, and Crankcase - Install - Install Crankshaft and Main Bearings

step1.para: Rotate engine so main bearing saddles are facing up. Clean bearing saddles with lint-free cloth. Supports must be free of oil.

note.para: Do not lubricate back side of bearing inserts.

step1.para: Install upper bearing inserts in bearing saddle. Make sure locking tangs on bearings are snapped in crankcase.
Apply marker die paste (Prussian Blue™ or equivalent ) to crankshaft main bearing journals. Carefully lower crankshaft on main bearing inserts in crankcase.

note.para: Do not install main bearing caps and lower bearing inserts at this time.

step1.para: Carefully remove crankshaft and inspect upper bearing inserts for an even transfer of bluing from journals to bearings.

note.para: If voids appeared in bluing transfer, crankcase integrity is questionable.

step1.para: If crankcase is not damaged and is free of distortion and burrs around upper bearing insert seats, clean all marker die paste from bearings and crankshaft journals.
Lubricate upper main bearing inserts with clean engine oil.
Carefully install crankshaft in main bearing saddles. Use an appropriate lifting sling to lower crankshaft.
